jigl.image
Class RealColorImage

java.lang.Object
  jigl.image.RealColorImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Image
public class RealColorImage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Image

A color image is a set of three gray image planes.

getColorModel

public final int getColorModel()
Returns the color model.
CMY = 1
YIQ = 2
HSV = 3
HLS = 4
default = RGB

Returns the color model.
CMY = 1
YIQ = 2
HSV = 3
HLS = 4
default = RGB

plane

public final RealGrayImage plane(int p)
Returns the plane of this image

If this were an RGB image, plane(0) would return the red plane.

p - the plane of this image
Returns:
a shallow copy

toString

public final java.lang.String toString()
Prints the string in integer format.
-Example of output on an image with width 100 and height 120:
100 : 120
10 87 32 65 32 65 40 59 43 12 43 ...
100 : 120
10 20 32 12 32 56 40 45 42 39 43 ...
100 : 120
10 20 32 12 54 56 73 59 42 23 43 ...

Specified by:
toString in interface Image

getJavaImage

public final java.awt.image.ImageProducer getJavaImage()

val0 - value to add to the pixel in the first plane
val1 - value to add to the pixel in the second plane
val2 - value to add to the pixel in the third plane
r - Region of Interest
Returns:
this

toString

public final java.lang.String toString(ROI r)
Prints a Region of Interest from this images in float format.
-Example of output on an image with width 100 and height 120:
100 : 120
10 87 32 65 32 65 40 59 43 12 43 ...
100 : 120
10 20 32 12 32 56 40 45 42 39 43 ...
100 : 120
10 20 32 12 54 56 73 59 42 23 43 ...

Parameters:
r - Region of Interest

byteSize

public void byteSize(ROI r)
Scales the range of this image to byte (0..255) in a Region of Interest

Parameters:
r - Region of Interest

clear

public final void clear(float v)
Clears an image to a value

Parameters:
v - value to clear to

clip

public final void clip(int min,
                       int max,
                       ROI r)
Clips the range of a Region of Interest to an arbitrary min/max

Parameters:
min - minimum value
max - maximum value
r - Region of Interest+
